00020 UINT32 guiStartupTime;
00021 UINT32 guiCurrentTime;
00022 
00023 void CALLBACK Clock( HWND hWindow, UINT uMessage, UINT idEvent, DWORD dwTime )
00024 {
00025   guiCurrentTime = GetTickCount();
00026   if (guiCurrentTime < guiStartupTime)
00027   { // Adjust guiCurrentTime because of loopback on the timer value
00028     guiCurrentTime = guiCurrentTime + (0xffffffff - guiStartupTime);
00029   }
00030   else
00031   { // Adjust guiCurrentTime because of loopback on the timer value
00032     guiCurrentTime = guiCurrentTime - guiStartupTime;
00033   }
00034 }
00035 
00036 BOOLEAN InitializeClockManager(void)
00037 {
00038 
00039   // Register the start time (use WIN95 API call)
00040   guiCurrentTime = guiStartupTime = GetTickCount();
00041   SetTimer(ghWindow, MAIN_TIMER_ID, 10, (TIMERPROC)Clock);
00042 
00043 
00044   return TRUE;
00045 }
00046 
00047 void    ShutdownClockManager(void)
00048 {
00049 
00050   // Make sure we kill the timer
00051   KillTimer(ghWindow, MAIN_TIMER_ID);
00052 
00053 }
00054 
00055 TIMER   GetClock(void)
00056 {
00057   return guiCurrentTime;
00058 }
00059 
00060 TIMER   SetCountdownClock(UINT32 uiTimeToElapse)
00061 {
00062   return (guiCurrentTime + uiTimeToElapse);
00063 }
00064 
00065 UINT32 ClockIsTicking(TIMER uiTimer)
00066 {
00067   if (uiTimer > guiCurrentTime)
00068   { // Well timer still hasn't elapsed
00069     return (uiTimer - guiCurrentTime);
00070   }
00071   // Time's up
00072   return 0;
00073 }
